1.subquestion: How much will be Lauren’s savings per year based on 20% of her income?

subanswer.text: With an annual salary of $100,000, if Lauren saves 20%, then her savings would be calculated as follows: Savings per Year (S) equals Salary ($100,000) times Saving Rate (R), or S = $100,000 * 20%.
